name: NPR
text:
In his new book, investigative journalist Dan Alexander assembles a detailed portrait of President Trump's business interests.

He says Trump has broken a number of vows he made about how he would conduct business while in office.
https://t.co/9VZxLvu0LK

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: The House passed a funding bill to keep the government running through Dec. 11 after it was delayed over a dispute on farm aid. The bill still needs Senate's approval and Trump's signature.
https://t.co/U49KyXNwBJ

name: NPR
text:
For about a century, big furniture companies have relied on the same business model for selling desks and chairs. But as the pandemic continues, the age of the home office is changing that. (@planetmoney)
https://t.co/b4MZ79jVQb

name: NPR
text:
President Trump says he has expanded a ban on racial sensitivity training to federal contractors after his administration instructed federal agencies to end such training earlier this month.
https://t.co/9u9PLQgsWd

name: NPR
text:
Facebook has taken down a network of China-based fake accounts whose posts included some content about the U.S. presidential election, but "gained almost no following" in the U.S.
https://t.co/Ra93s0o2zi
